sentences.english: He fixes his eyes on the greyish spine of the old wolf as he swoops down.
sentences.chinese: 他兩眼死死盯住老狼灰黑的脊背。

sentences.english: Pretty soon you won't have the burden of making eye contact at the grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 很快地你將不負有舉證責任死死地盯着雜貨店。

sentences.english: His heart thumped audibly as his benumbed hand held the receiver in a desperate grip.
sentences.chinese: 他的心怦怦跳着，痙攣的手死死地攥住電話聽筒。

sentences.english: She stopped, and he stopped with her, and she stared into his haggard, burning face.
sentences.chinese: 她的目光死死地盯着他那憔悴而熾熱的臉。

sentences.english: Maintain eye contact in a way that is not a stare-down.
sentences.chinese: 保持眼神交流，但不要死死地盯着對方。

sentences.english: I suppose you're here to collect the reward for killing those murlocs?
sentences.chinese: 我想你來這裏是爲了拿回死死魚人所應得的獎勵吧？

sentences.english: For say, he merely stared at me.
sentences.chinese: 他不回答，只是兩眼死死地盯着我。

sentences.english: How did Alice manage to entangle her hair so badly in the brambles ?
sentences.chinese: 愛麗絲是怎麼把頭髮死死地纏在野生灌木上的？

sentences.english: It was full of golden potion and the cork was still tightly sealed with wax.
sentences.chinese: 滿滿一瓶金黃色的藥水，塞子仍然用蠟封得死死的。

sentences.english: We should never go back to the old days of tramping the economy to death.
sentences.chinese: 我們決不能重複回到過去那樣，把經濟搞得死死的。

sentences.english: With half an eye Soapy saw that the policeman was watching him fixedly .
sentences.chinese: 他斜眼望去，看見那個警察正死死盯住他。

sentences.english: He hung on until at last the rope broke and he crashed to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他死死地抓住繩子，直到繩斷人摔到地上爲止。

sentences.english: With his huge body, he overbore his opponent under him dead.
sentences.chinese: 他用他那龐大的身軀把對手死死地壓在身下。

sentences.english: Civilisations live and die by their founding myths.
sentences.chinese: 各種文明都在它們的創始神話中生生死死。

sentences.english: Marion looked at me as if I had a frog crawling out of my eye.
sentences.chinese: 馬裏恩死死盯着我，好像從我眼裏爬出一隻青蛙似的。

definition: to watch sb closely/to breathe down sb's neck/to mark (sports)
to be unable to move a single step
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
to watch attentively/to fix one's attention on/to stare at/to gaze at
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
